alternatives.transcript: leslie palmer is a sixty two year old female presenting to the emergency room today with a history of fatigue shortness of breath palpitations and presyncopy she has she has a two month history of these symptoms they're worse with activity she's seen her primary care provider about it who has ordered several tests done which she does not have the results of yet patient states that she has begun sleeping in her recliner due to significant orthopnea and recently her symptoms have gotten much worse prompting her to present to the emergency room review of systems pertinent positives includes an eight pound weight gain under general review systems significant lower extremity edema under musculoskeletal and then under cardiopulmonary the patient has significant palpitations presyncopy wheezing and orthopnea skin heent and neuro review of systems were all negative prior medical history for this patient includes hypertension pulmonary sarcoidosis diagnosed twenty five years ago per patient report family history is significant for sudden death of her mother when she was about forty cause is unknown for her father cause of death was myocardial infarction at age fifty nine patient's pertinent social history is positive for caffeine moderate use approximately one cup per day no alcohol no tobacco no drugs her diet is balanced exercise she takes walks once per day but states that she has been unable to due to her symptoms and their worsening she lives at home with family and is an elementary school teacher patient's medications include lisinopril ten milligrams once daily and prednisone ten milligrams once daily there are no known drug allergies to report vitals today include a blood pressure of one thirty six over ninety nine temperature ninety eight point six pulse of one ten respiration rate of twenty and pulse oxygen of ninety one percent physical exam was positive for jugular venous distension an s four gallop with systolic murmur rally's and wheezing and plus one pitting edema in the lower extremity labs showed an elevated bmp chest x-ray showed pulmonary edema and mediastinal fullness echocardiogram showed restrictive cardiomyopathy with increased wall thickness and an ejection fraction of fifty five percent with all these in mind and the physical exam the primary diagnosis today is sarcoidosis restrictive cardiomyopathy with secondary diagnosis of pulmonary sarcoidosis and hypertension this patient should be admitted to telemetry under serious condition nursing orders include strict ins and outs daily weights dvt prophylaxis and oxygen via cannula to keep oxygen sets above ninety six percent no imaging or labs to be ordered diet includes a low sodium diet to prevent further worsening of pulmonary edema and peripheral edema patient can be out of bed with assistance no iv fluids at this time due to the fluid overload we do want iv access established and keep the vein open meds we want to increase prednisone to sixty milligrams once daily continue lisinopril ten milligrams once daily and then add amiodarone hundred and fifty milligrams once daily due to ekg showing unsustained ventricular tachycardia we also want to have consultations with nuclear medicine for an fdg pet scan and cardiology for possible aicd implantation
